title: Glass Fragments Found in Sugar Syrup Prompts Recall by SweetTreats Inc.
text: SweetTreats Inc. has issued a recall for their sugar syrup products due to the potential presence of glass fragments. The company initiated this recall after receiving consumer complaints and internal quality checks identified the issue. The affected products were distributed nationwide through various retail stores and online platforms. The syrup is commonly used in beverages, baking, and confectionery. Consumers are advised to check their products and return them to the point of purchase for a full refund. The recall affects all syrup products with batch numbers starting with 'GH2021'. No injuries have been reported to date, but the company urges caution due to the risk of injury from glass fragments. For further information, consumers can contact SweetTreats Inc. customer service at 0800-123-4567, available Monday through Friday from 8 am to 6 pm. The company is working closely with regulatory authorities to ensure all affected products are removed from the market.

title: Urgent Recall of BeeSweet Pure Honey Due to Presence of Unauthorised Antibiotics
text: Urgent Recall of BeeSweet Pure Honey Due to Presence of Unauthorised Antibiotics Issue Date 15.10.2022 Source of Information UK Food Standards Agency Food Product Bottled honey Product Name and Description Product: BeeSweet Pure Honey Brand: Nature's Delight Distributor: GreenMeadow Ltd. Net weight: 500 grams per bottle Best-before date: March 15, 2024 Reason For Issuing Alert The UK Food Standards Agency collected the above-mentioned honey sample from a retail store in London for testing under its routine Food Surveillance Programme. The test result showed that the sample contained streptomycin at a level of 2.8 micrograms per kg. According to the Joint FAO/WHO Expert Committee on Food Additives (JECFA), residues of streptomycin or its metabolites may cause significant health concerns, and competent authorities should prevent residues of streptomycin in food. Action Taken by the UK Food Standards Agency The UK Food Standards Agency has notified the vendor concerned of the test result and instructed it to stop selling the affected batch of the product. The distributor concerned has also initiated a recall on the affected batch of the product according to the UK Food Standards Agency's instruction. The UK Food Standards Agency is tracing the source and distribution of the food in question. Prosecution will be instituted should there be sufficient evidence. The UK Food Standards Agency will alert the trade, continue to follow up on the case and take appropriate action. An investigation is ongoing. Advice to the Trade Stop using or selling the products concerned immediately if they possess them. Advice to Consumers Members of the public may call its hotline at 020 7276 8658 during office hours for enquiries about the recall of the product. Further Information The UK Food Standards Agency press release Food Standards Agency 2022-10-15 Back

title: Food Recall: Sunnyvale Foods Issues Allergy Alert on Undeclared Soy in Chocolate Flavoring
text: Sunnyvale Foods of Birmingham, UK, is recalling its Chocolate Flavoring due to the presence of undeclared soy. People who have an allergy or severe sensitivity to soy run the risk of a serious or life-threatening allergic reaction if they consume this product. The product was distributed nationwide in the UK. The recalled product is identified by the name Chocolate Flavoring with product code 456789 and lot number 123456A789B. The lot number is located on the bottom of the packaging. The product was produced on October 15, 2022, and has a best before date of October 14, 2024. The product is packaged in 1 kg (2.2 lbs) bags, 10 bags per case. No other Sunnyvale Foods products or Chocolate Flavoring lot numbers are recalled. The recall was initiated after it was discovered that several units from the identified lot number tested positive for the presence of soy and were distributed in packaging that did not reveal the presence of soy in the product. A subsequent investigation is ongoing. No adverse events or reports of illness or injury related to this matter have been reported to date. Sunnyvale Foods recommends that anyone who purchased or is in possession of the product immediately discontinue use and verify if they retain the affected lot. Those in possession of recalled lot #123456A789B should contact Sunnyvale Foods at 0121 123 4567 for further instruction. Businesses carrying this product should return it to the headquarters in Birmingham for product replacement or credit. Sunnyvale Foods will arrange for the return of the product at no cost. If you have questions or inquiries please call this designated line: 0121 123 4567, or email info@sunnyvalefoods.co.uk, Monday – Friday 9:00 a.m. – 5:00 p.m. GMT. This recall is being made with the knowledge of the UK Food Standards Agency.

title: Recall of Golden Sunrise Food Dye Due to Contamination with Propylene Glycol
text: Golden Sunrise is recalling its line of food dyes due to the detection of propylene glycol, a chemical not approved for use in food dyes in the United States. The affected products include Golden Sunrise Red, Blue, and Green food dyes in all pack sizes and batches. Consumers are advised not to use these products and to return them to the place of purchase for a full refund. The company has initiated a recall and is working with retailers to remove the products from shelves. For more information, contact Golden Sunrise customer service at 1-800-555-1234. The FDA is monitoring the recall and will provide updates as necessary. Product details: Golden Sunrise Red Pack size: All sizes Batch code: All batches Best before: All dates Golden Sunrise Blue Pack size: All sizes Batch code: All batches Best before: All dates Golden Sunrise Green Pack size: All sizes Batch code: All batches Best before: All dates Risk statement: Propylene glycol contamination Propylene glycol is not approved for use in food dyes in the United States. Consumption of affected products may cause allergic reactions in sensitive individuals. Action taken by the company: Golden Sunrise is recalling the above products. Point of sale notices will be displayed in all retail stores that are selling these products. These notices explain to customers why the products are being recalled and tell them what to do if they have bought the products. Please see the attached notice. Consumer Notice: Golden Sunrise recalls food dyes due to propylene glycol contamination. Our advice to consumers If you have bought any of the above products do not use it. Instead, return it to the store from where it was bought for a full refund. About product recalls and withdrawals If there is a problem with a food product that means it should not be sold, then it might be \'withdrawn\' (taken off the shelves) or \'recalled\' (when customers are asked to return the product). The FDA issues Product Withdrawal Information Notices and Product Recall Information Notices to let consumers and local authorities know about problems associated with food. In some cases, a \'Food Alert for Action\' is issued. This provides local authorities with details of specific action to be taken on behalf of consumers. L'ANSES émet des Avis d'Information sur le Retrait de Produits et des Avis d'Information sur le Rappel de Produits pour informer les consommateurs et les autorités locales des problèmes associés aux aliments. Dans certains cas, une \'Alerte Alimentaire pour Action\' est émise. Cela fournit aux autorités locales des détails sur les mesures spécifiques à prendre au nom des consommateurs. title: Purrfect Paws Ltd. Recalls Select Batches of Kitty Krunch Dry Cat Food Due to Potential Listeria Contamination
text: Purrfect Paws Ltd. of Birmingham, UK, is recalling specific batches of Kitty Krunch Dry Cat Food due to potential contamination with Listeria monocytogenes. The contamination was identified during routine quality control checks. The affected products were distributed to retail stores and online platforms across the UK. To date, no illnesses related to this product have been reported. Listeria monocytogenes can cause serious and sometimes fatal infections in young children, frail or elderly people, and others with weakened immune systems. Although healthy individuals may suffer only short-term symptoms such as high fever, severe headache, stiffness, nausea, abdominal pain, and diarrhea, Listeria monocytogenes infection can cause miscarriages and stillbirths among pregnant women. Consumers who have purchased the affected products are advised to discontinue use immediately and return the product to the place of purchase for a full refund. For further information, consumers can contact Purrfect Paws Ltd. at 0121-345-6789 (Monday – Friday, 9:00 AM-4:00 PM, GMT). Recalled Product Details: Kitty Krunch Dry Cat Food, 2KG bag, Batch Code: LK2308, Best Before: 12/2024.

title: Nature's Choice Pet Foods Issues Recall of Certain Dog Food Products due to Potential Salmonella Contamination
text: Nature's Choice Pet Foods is issuing a voluntary recall of specific dog food products due to potential contamination with Salmonella. The risk was identified during routine testing by the Canadian Food Inspection Agency (CFIA). Although no illnesses have been reported to date, consumers are advised to take precautions. Salmonella can affect animals consuming the product and poses a risk to humans handling contaminated products, especially if they have not thoroughly washed their hands afterward. Symptoms in humans can include nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, abdominal cramping, and fever. Pets with Salmonella infections may exhibit lethargy, diarrhea, fever, and vomiting, although some may only show decreased appetite and abdominal pain. Infected pets can also be carriers and infect other animals or humans. Consumers who have purchased the affected products should discontinue use and return them to the place of purchase for a full refund. For further information, consumers can contact Nature's Choice Pet Foods customer service at (800) 705-2112 from 8 AM to 5 PM Eastern Time, Monday through Friday, or email customer.service@natureschoicepetfoods.com. This recall is being conducted in cooperation with the CFIA.

title: NutriPaws Recalls 'Chicken Delight' Raw Dog Food Due to Potential Listeria Contamination
text: NutriPaws of Vancouver, BC is recalling its Chicken Delight raw dog food due to potential contamination with Listeria monocytogenes. The affected product was distributed in British Columbia and Alberta through specialized pet stores and online retailers. Listeria monocytogenes can cause serious and sometimes fatal infections in young children, frail or elderly people, and others with weakened immune systems. Although healthy individuals may suffer only short-term symptoms such as high fever, severe headache, stiffness, nausea, abdominal pain, and diarrhea, Listeria infection can cause miscarriages and stillbirths among pregnant women. Animals ill with Listeria monocytogenes will display symptoms similar to humans, including diarrhea and vomiting. Even if pets do not show symptoms, they can still spread the bacteria to humans. Consumers who have purchased the recalled product are urged to discontinue use immediately and return it to the place of purchase for a full refund. The product comes in a 2-pound package marked with lot #050823 on the bottom left corner of the label. The contamination was discovered during routine testing by the Canadian Food Inspection Agency. NutriPaws has ceased the production and distribution of the product as the company continues to investigate the source of the problem. For more information, consumers can contact NutriPaws at 604-123-4567 or via email at info@nutripaws.com. Business Hours: Monday to Friday, 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM PST.

title: PetSafe Recalls Certain Batches of Dog Food Due to Elevated Levels of Vitamin D
text: PetSafe is voluntarily recalling specific batches of its Premium Dog Food due to elevated levels of Vitamin D, which can be harmful to dogs. Excessive Vitamin D can lead to symptoms such as vomiting, loss of appetite, increased thirst, increased urination, and excessive drooling. In severe cases, it can cause kidney damage. The affected batches were distributed in California, Oregon, and Washington between June and July 2023. The recall includes the following lot numbers: 20230615 and 20230701. Consumers who have purchased these products are urged to stop feeding them to their pets and return them to the place of purchase for a full refund. For more information, contact PetSafe customer service at 800-555-1234 between 9 a.m. and 5 p.m. Pacific Time, Monday through Friday

title: Waggin' Train Voluntarily Recalls Select Chicken Jerky Products Due to Possible Chemical Contamination
text: Waggin' Train, a popular brand of dog treats, is voluntarily recalling select packages of its chicken jerky products due to potential chemical contamination. The affected products were distributed nationwide in Canada and may contain traces of a chemical used in cleaning agents, which could pose a health risk to pets if ingested. The recall affects 10-ounce packages of Waggin' Train Chicken Jerky Tenders with the following lot codes: 459782, 459801, and 459823. These products have best-by dates ranging from June 2023 to August 2023. Consumers who have purchased these products should dispose of them immediately and contact Waggin' Train customer service at 1-800-525-5291 for a full refund. Waggin' Train is committed to the safety and well-being of pets and is taking this action out of an abundance of caution. No illnesses have been reported to date, but pet owners are urged to monitor their pets for any signs of illness and consult a veterinarian if necessary. title: Jamieson Foods Ltd—Recall of Chocolate Chip Cookies
text: FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE - October 15, 2023 - Jamieson Foods Ltd is voluntarily recalling certain batches of their Chocolate Chip Cookies due to the presence of undeclared milk, an allergen. People who have an allergy or severe sensitivity to milk run the risk of an allergic reaction if they consume this product. The recall was initiated after it was discovered that the product packaging did not declare the presence of milk. There have been no reports of illness to date. The recall applies to the following products: 'Jamieson Chocolate Chip Cookies' packaged in plastic trays with the UPC code 123456789012 and a 'Best Before' date between September 1, 2023, and December 31, 2023. This date can be found on the back of the package. Consumers who are allergic to milk should not consume this product and return it to the place of purchase for a full refund. For further information, consumers can contact Jamieson Foods Ltd at 0800-123-4567 daily between 8 a.m. and 6 p.m. GMT.

title: California Company Recalls Vegetable Soup Due to Undeclared Milk Allergen
text:
SACRAMENTO, January 15, 2014 - Green Valley Soups, a Sacramento-based company, is recalling approximately 12,000 cans of its Vegetable Soup due to the presence of undeclared milk. The product may contain milk, a known allergen, which is not declared on the product label.

The affected product, Green Valley Vegetable Soup, is packaged in 15-ounce cans with a lot code of '345678' and a best-by date of 'May 2015'. The soup was distributed to retail stores in California, Nevada, and Oregon.

The issue was discovered during a routine inspection by the company, which revealed that the soup may have been inadvertently packaged in cans intended for a different product that contains milk.

Consumers who have purchased the affected product are urged to return it to the place of purchase for a full refund. Individuals with an allergy or severe sensitivity to milk run the risk of serious or life-threatening allergic reaction if they consume this product.

For more information, consumers can contact Green Valley Soups at 1-800-555-1234. Media with questions about the recall should contact Janet Smith, Public Relations, at (916) 123-4567.

title: Major Retailer Recalls Frozen Pizza Due To Mislabeling And Undeclared Allergens
text:
OTTAWA, October 15, 2017 – A major Canadian retailer is recalling its frozen pizza products due to mislabeling and undeclared allergens. The products, labeled as vegetarian, actually contain chicken, which is a known allergen. Additionally, the packaging does not declare the presence of milk and soy, which are also potential allergens.
                                  
The following products are subject to recall: 
                                   - 500g boxes of Veggie Delight Pizza containing chicken, milk, and soy.
                                  
The products bear the establishment number EST. 1234 inside the CFIA mark of inspection on the label. They were produced between September 1, 2017, and October 10, 2017, and were distributed nationwide through various retail stores.
                                  
The issue was discovered during a routine inspection by the Canadian Food Inspection Agency (CFIA). There have been no reported cases of adverse reactions related to the consumption of these products.
                                  
Consumers who have purchased these products are advised not to consume them. These products should be returned to the place of purchase for a full refund. Consumers with questions can contact the retailer's customer service at 1-800-555-1234.
                                  
The CFIA is conducting a food safety investigation, which may lead to the recall of other products. If other high-risk products are recalled, the CFIA will notify the public through updated Food Recall Warnings.

title: Recall of Various Organic Vegetables Due to Listeria Contamination
text:
Recall of Various Organic Vegetables Due to Listeria Contamination

Several batches of organic vegetables, including spinach, kale, and arugula, have been found to be contaminated with Listeria monocytogenes. This bacterium can cause serious and sometimes fatal infections in young children, frail or elderly people, and others with weakened immune systems. Although healthy individuals may suffer only short-term symptoms such as high fever, severe headache, stiffness, nausea, abdominal pain, and diarrhea, Listeria infection can cause miscarriages and stillbirths among pregnant women.

Product identification
List of recalled products
Product name	Size	Use by date
Organic Spinach	200g	01/06/23 until 15/06/23
Organic Kale	300g	01/06/23 until 15/06/23
Organic Arugula	150g	01/06/23 until 15/06/23
Action taken by the company
The company has initiated a recall from customers and is removing the affected products from the shelves. Point-of-sale notices have been produced for establishments supplied with affected batches.

No other products are known to be affected.

Advice to consumers
If you have purchased any of the above products before Saturday 10 June 2023, please do not consume these products. Instead, return the product to the store where you purchased it from. Any of the above products purchased on or after Saturday 10 June 2023 which have both a use-by date and a new batch code (beginning with 000002) are safe to consume as per instructions on the back of the packaging.

title: Recall of Dairyland Cheese Products Due to Possible Spoilage
text:
WASHINGTON, May 12, 2016 – Dairyland Inc., a Wisconsin-based company, is recalling approximately 15,000 pounds of various cheese products due to potential spoilage issues, the U.S. Department of Agriculture’s Food Safety and Inspection Service (FSIS) announced today.

The cheese products were produced between April 1, 2016, and May 10, 2016. The following products are subject to recall: [View Labels(PDF Only)]

8 oz. packages of Dairyland “Sharp Cheddar Cheese” bearing the plant number P-1234, the line number RS05, and Product UPC 0 12345 67890 1, with “Best By” dates of 06 JUN 2016 through 12 JUL 2016.

16 oz. packages of Dairyland “Mild Cheddar Cheese” bearing the plant number P-1234, the line number RS05, and Product UPC 0 12345 67891 8, with “Best By” dates of 07 JUN 2016 through 15 JUL 2016.

The products subject to recall bear the establishment number “P-1234” inside the USDA mark of inspection, as well as the line number “RS05”. These items were shipped nationwide and exported to Canada and Mexico.

The problem was discovered by the establishment during routine quality control checks. 

FSIS has not received any confirmed reports of adverse reactions related to the consumption of these products. However, consumers who have purchased these products are urged not to consume them. These products should be thrown away or returned to the place of purchase.

Consumers with questions about the recall can contact Dairyland Customer Service at (800) 555-1234. Media with questions about the recall can contact Sarah Johnson, Public Relations, at (800) 555-4321.

Consumers with food safety questions can Ask Karen, the FSIS virtual representative available 24 hours a day at AskKaren.gov or via smartphone at m.askkaren.gov. The toll-free USDA Meat and Poultry Hotline 1-888-MPHotline (1-888-674-6854) is available in English and Spanish and can be reached from 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. (Eastern Time) Monday through Friday. Recorded food safety messages are available 24 hours a day. The online Electronic Consumer Complaint Monitoring System can be accessed 24 hours a day at: http://www.fsis.usda.gov/reportproblem.

title: Withdrawal of 1.5L bottles of Acqua Pura due to unusual taste

This product is bottled at the company's facility in Florence, Italy, and is mainly distributed within Italy.
